title: Do I need a new computer?
body:
Recently, I got a 32 inch monitor/TV and used it instead of my 20 inch monitor, now my league runs at 31 fps instead of 120 fps. I'm not that good with computers and shit so imma just give y'all the specs. ( I run league at lowest vid quality)

Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-3210M CPU @2.50 Ghz 2.50 Ghz

Windows 7 Home Premium

Here's the other [specs](https://www.cnet.com/products/lenovo-essential-g480/specs/)

replies.body: As SephirothSG mentioned, the i5 is a pretty decent CPU that should do the job of running League of Legends, and 8GB RAM is more than enough as well. Chances are that you're being bottlenecked with your graphics unit. You *could* buy a new computer, but you could also see if you can swap out the Intel HD Graphics unit. Let me know if you have any questions!

Hey there,

I would suggest investing in a system that has a dedicated GPU rather than the onboard intel graphics chipset.
